messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] looking for someone
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Arnold, Yes, I am trying to figure out how to buy it,m and I was able to contact Steve. I had seen the blade before it was polished and also OKed it for
messages.messageBody:
Hi Arnold,

Yes, I am trying to figure out how to buy it,m and I was able to
contact Steve. I had seen the blade before it was polished and also
OKed it for Yushu-saku. It is a very fine piece and I hope I can figure
out a way to put the money together. The Sano trip was, as always, a
real pleasure. Watanabe sensei got me to do some translation work for
her, and she put out some very fine pieces. I particularly like the
Chu-Aoe blade. If you remember Okada san's Yosazaemon Sukesada katana
we brought over last year, the Aoe blade looked just like it -- only
better. It was pretty clear seeing that blade that Yosazaemon was
copying the Chu-Aoe style of workmanship down to the shape of the
blade. Anyway, there will always be a next time.

Gordon

On ì˙ójì˙, 11 21, 2004, at 10:47 PM, arnold frenzel wrote:

> Hi Gordon:
> It is <stevey@...>. In case you haven't reached him he

messages.subject: RE: [nihontostudy] looking for someone
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Gordon: It is . In case you haven t reached him he has a nice Kanabo naginata, Yushusaku, similar, but much shorter than, the
messages.messageBody:
Hi Gordon:
It is <stevey@...>. In case you haven't reached him he
has a nice Kanabo naginata, Yushusaku, similar, but much shorter than,
the long one you have and it is for sale.
I am sorry I could not make that Shizuoka trip with you as I would like
to have met the lady and see some of their material, but I had a
conflict. I hope it went well.
Regards, Arnold

>>> robsongo@... 11/17/04 10:37 PM >>>

Hi all,



I am looking for an LA area collector whose name I am pretty sure is
Steven
Yap. Does anyone have his e-mail address?



Gordon



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: crass commercial message
messages.msgSnippet: All, I currently have full set of Toso Kodogu Koza for sale. All 8 volumes in mint condition ( book 5 has a small amount of foxing, more a little stain on the
messages.messageBody:
All, I currently have full set of Toso Kodogu Koza for sale. All 8
volumes in mint condition ( book 5 has a small amount of foxing, more a
little stain on the outside of the pages ) All in cardboard sleeves.
These will be going up on Ebay soon so I thought I'd off them here
first. These books are for the advanced kodogu collector and are in
Japanese. Excellent images of many tsuba, kozuka and other kodogu.

If your interested in them and want to discuss the price or want some
photo's, email me at ikkanshi@...

cheers

Rich Turner

messages.subject: Los Angeles study group
messages.msgSnippet: Greetings all, Just wondering if there are any Southern California study group members here, and whether it is known if the group is meeting tomorrow (November
messages.messageBody:
Greetings all,

Just wondering if there are any Southern California study group
members here, and whether it is known if the group is meeting
tomorrow (November 12th). I am new to the group, and
understand that meetings are usually the second friday of every
month, but I wanted to be sure that this month's meeting is
happening as "scheduled." Any info on this is appreciated.
Thanks.
